problem: Find the coefficient of $x$ when $(7+8x)-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)$ is simplified.
solution: Ignoring the non-linear terms, we see that the coefficient of $x$ is  \[1\cdot8-3\cdot6+9\cdot3=8-18+27=\boxed{17}.\]
model_solution:
## Step 1: Distribute the coefficients to the terms inside the parentheses
$(7+8x)-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)$ = $7+8x-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)$
## Step 2: Continue distributing the coefficients to the terms inside the parentheses
$7+8x-6-18x-6x^2+9+27x+36x^2+108x^3-63+9x^2+72x^3-117x^4$
## Step 3: Combine like terms to simplify the expression
$7-6+9-63+8x-18x+27x+72x^3+108x^3-72x^3-6x^2+36x^2+9x^2-117x^4$
$=-53+(-2)x+(108+72-72)x^3+(36+9-6)x^2$
$=-53-2x+108x^3+39x^2$
## Step 4: Identify the coefficient of the term with $x$
$-2$
## Step 5: Identify the coefficient of $x$
$-2$
## Step 6: Identify the coefficient of $x^0$ term.
$-53$
## Step 7: 
$-2$
## Step 8:  The coefficient of $x$ is $-2$.
## Step 9: The coefficient of $x$ is $-2$.
## Step 10: The coefficient of $x$ is $-2$.
